name: subclassification
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the act or process of dividing a group of things or people into smaller groups, according to their type: subclassification of These methods may allow for more precise subclassification of behavioural symptoms. As the number of meteorites increases, their sub-classification into separate types has become more specific.
[ C ] a smaller group that a group of people or things is divided into: subclassification of The rather complex subclassifications of the disorder are listed below. Even within the above-mentioned categories, there are sub-classification.
More examplesFewer examplesSix hundred tumours were reviewed for subclassification.She suggests that we need to devise a workable system of subclassification.There is a sub-classification of plants by size and leaf colour.Finally, subclassifications could not be determined for three of the children. All of the zoning types above have different subclassifications that vary from municipality to municipality.
